t: To*pn you, Lord,*s I call; you*ld are my Rock, do*ld not turn a deaf ear to me. For*ln if you remain silent, I*ld will be like those who go down to the pit.
Hear*ln my cry for mercy as*ld I call to you for help, as*ln I lift up my hands toward*ld your Most Holy Place.
Do*pn not drag me away with the wicked, with*ld those who do evil, who*ln speak cordially with their neighbors but*ld harbor malice in their hearts.
Repay*ln them for their deeds and*ld for their evil work; repay*ln them for what their hands have done and*ld bring back on them what they deserve.
Because*pn they have no regard for the deeds of the Lord*s and*ld what his hands have done, he*ln will tear them down and*ld never build them up again.
Praise*pn be to the Lord,*s for*ld he has heard my cry for mercy.
The*ln Lord*s is my strength and my shield; my*ld heart trusts in him, and he helps me. My*ln heart leaps for joy, and*ld with my song I praise him.
The*pn Lord*s is the strength of his people, a*ld fortress of salvation for his anointed one.
Save*ln your people and bless your inheritance; be*ld their shepherd and carry them forever.
